intro: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation.
JSON is a syntax for storing and exchanging data.
JSON is a lightweight data-interchange format.
JSON is text, written with JavaScript object notation.
syntax: JSON syntax is derived from JavaScript object notation syntax.
Data is in name/value pairs, which consist of a field name (in double quotes), followed by a colon, followed by a value.
JSON names require double quotes. JavaScript names don't.
Strings in JSON must be written in double quotes.
Objects as values in JSON must follow the same rules as JSON objects.
